dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, huge news in the financial world this week, right? Alibaba, um, making headlines again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, huge news in the financial world this week, right? Alibaba, um, making headlines again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, A! They're doing this big secondary listing in Hong Kong, like, raising a ton of cash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, A! They're doing this big secondary listing in Hong Kong, like, raising a ton of cash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The debut on the Hong Kong stock exchange is a secondary listing for Alibaba, which initially went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2014, raising $25 billion in the worlds biggest IPO in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, up to $12.9 billion, which is, you know, massive. And it's interesting because they're doing it to, uh, reduce their reliance on the U.S. market, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, up to twelve point nine billion dollars, which is, you know, massive. And it's interesting because they're doing it to, uh, reduce their reliance on the U S market, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the worlds biggest IPO so far this year, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is set to raise up to $12.9 billion in a landmark public listing in Hong Kong...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. I mean, they originally went public in New York back in 2014, that huge $25 billion IPO. This time, they're pricing shares at a slight discount, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. I mean, they originally went public in New York back in twenty fourteen, that huge twenty five billion dollar I P O. This time, they're pricing shares at a slight discount, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...initially went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2014, raising $25 billion in the worlds biggest IPO in history. Alibaba said that it would price shares at $HK176 ($22.50) each, a discount of 2.9% to its New York Stock Exchange closing price...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, HK$176 each. But get this, even with that, it's still the biggest IPO globally so far this year!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, H K one hundred seventy six each. But get this, even with that, it's still the biggest I P O globally so far this year!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba said that it would price shares at $HK176 ($22.50) each... It would also be the worlds biggest IPO so far in 2019: Alibabas Hong Kong listing exceeds Ubers $8.1 billion public debut in New York...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, but they actually had a bit of a bumpy start, didn't they? Demand was kinda low initially, so they even had to extend their book closure date.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but they actually had a bit of a bumpy start, didn't they? Demand was kinda low initially, so they even had to extend their book closure date.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the skyrocketing demand for shares caused Alibaba to close its books earlier than expected, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild. Still, it blows Uber's $8.1 billion debut out of the water, and even AB InBev's Asia listing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild. Still, it blows Uber's eight point one billion dollar debut out of the water, and even A B InBev's Asia listing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas Hong Kong listing exceeds Ubers $8.1 billion public debut in New York and AB InBevs $5 billion IPO of its Asia business in Hong Kong earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really does. And if this goes through, their cash pile could swell to like, $44 billion. More than any other internet company, double Tencent!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does. And if this goes through, their cash pile could swell to like, forty four billion dollars. More than any other internet company, double Tencent!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Scheduled for November 26, the listing could swell Alibabas cash pile to around $44 billion, which would be more than any other internet company and double that of rival e-commerce giant Tencent, according to Bloomberg.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. Double Tencent? That's insane. But, um, it might actually get overshadowed by Saudi Aramco's IPO, though, right? That one's projected to be even bigger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. Double Tencent? That's insane. But, um, it might actually get overshadowed by Saudi Aramco's I P O, though, right? That one's projected to be even bigger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will likely be eclipsed by Saudi Arabias state oil giant Saudi Aramco, going public on the Riyadh stock exchange in December, with its IPO set to raise up to $25.6 billion...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. Aramco's aiming for like, $25.6 billion, potentially the second-largest IPO *ever*. So Alibaba's moment might be brief.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. Aramco's aiming for like, twenty five point six billion dollars, potentially the second largest I P O ever. So Alibaba's moment might be brief.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...that could break Alibabas existing record for the worlds largest IPO in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: True. What about the impact on Hong Kong itself? I read it's actually pretty minor, despite the huge numbers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True. What about the impact on Hong Kong itself? I read it's actually pretty minor, despite the huge numbers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will help boost Hong Kongs financial markets, given that the city recently slid into recession for the first time in over a decade, following more than five months of anti-government protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, surprisingly. Hong Kong's financial markets have been strong for a decade. Plus, with the US-China trade war easing a bit, it's not expected to shake things up too much.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, surprisingly. Hong Kong's financial markets have been strong for a decade. Plus, with the U S China trade war easing a bit, it's not expected to shake things up too much.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the city recently slid into recession for the first time in over a decade...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, it won't necessarily, like, make other Chinese unicorns flock to Hong Kong over the US for their own listings?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it won't necessarily, like, make other Chinese unicorns flock to Hong Kong over the U S for their own listings?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...that could set an example for other Chinese unicorns to opt for Hong Kong over the U.S. when they go public.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Probably not significantly. But speaking of Alibaba's power, did you see their Singles Day numbers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Probably not significantly. But speaking of Alibaba's power, did you see their Singles Day numbers?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...that could set an example for other Chinese unicorns to opt for Hong Kong over the U.S. when they go public.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yes! $38.4 billion in gross merchandise volume in 24 hours! That's just... [interrupts]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! thirty eight point four billion dollars in gross merchandise volume in twenty four hours! That's just...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its eleventh edition of Singles Day, the biggest shopping event in the world, Alibaba set a new sales record of $38.4 billion in gross merchandise volume during the 24-hour shopping bonanza.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Insane, right? That's more than Black Friday, Cyber Monday, *and* Amazon Prime Day combined here in the US.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Insane, right? That's more than Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Amazon Prime Day combined here in the U S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...with Alibabas haul more than double the amount sold on last years Black Friday, Cyber Monday and Amazon Prime Day combined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. Just shows you the sheer scale of their operations, uh, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. Just shows you the sheer scale of their operations, uh, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. They're just in a league of their own.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. They're just in a league of their own.
